page.title: 03BRENDON TWO GATES
page.content:
A well known landmark on Exmoor is Brendon Two Gates.
Today, traffic passes freely across the moor over a cattle grid. One hundred years ago the two gate system gave its name to this spot.
This system had two gates hung on one post so that both fell inwards. The winds could not blow both gates open and farmers on horseback could pass through without dismounting. They did this by pulling back one gate and the horse, walking forward, pushed open the other. There are no signs of these gates today.
From this spot there are large, panoramic views of Exmoor.
